Dillon's

4.6
395 Reviews
$30 and under
American

Top Tags:

Great for Outdoor Dining
Neighborhood Gem
Casual
A Back Bay favorite, Dillon’s is known for its warm hospitality, friendly staff, and spirited nightlife. This historic landmark, built in 1887, was the original home of Boston Police Departments Division 16 and named after famed Captain S. Dillon who was stationed there from 1920-1950.

Situated close to Fenway Park, Dillon’s has always been the gathering spot for both before and after Fenway. Located steps away from Hynes Convention Center and the Prudential Center, Dillons is the perfect spot for a post conference night cap or mid day lunch break.

The All-American menu featuring locally sourced ingredients, two bars, multiple function spaces and the best patio in the area Dillon’s has remained a Back Bay favorite. From a quiet intimate dinner for two, a lively weekend brunch with friends, or even a large corporate function, Dillon’s is the Back Bay restaurant to accommodate all of your needs.

Safety precautions

Cleaning & Sanitizing
  • Surfaces sanitized between seatings
  • Common areas deep cleaned daily
  • Digital, disposable or sanitized menu provided
  • Sanitizer or wipes provided for customers
Physical Distancing
  • Limited number of seated diners
  • Distancing maintained in common areas
  • Extra space between tables
Protective Equipment
  • Waitstaff wear masks
  • Diners must wear masks unless eating or drinking
Screening
  • Sick staff prohibited in the workplace

If you want to watch a big sports game, dillons is not the place to go. They will not turn on the sound for a big game (European finals) even though the only people at 3pm on a Sunday were there for the game. Waiters were somewhat nice about it. One waiter apologized, the other claimed they were not “registered as a sports bar”, the other claimed a “sound technician was being called but probably wouldn’t make it in time”. Otherwise seemed like a lovely place and our waiter was nice about the whole thing.

Overall3food3service3ambience2

We went for a late dinner on a Saturday night. Food was average with the service being slow likely due to the game and Saturday night crowd. It was exceptionally loud and though at a table the bar crowd incroached on our table and expedidited our departure. We had a busy day touring the city and were looking for a quick, late night good bite to eat. We didn' expect such a crowd and noise.

+ Read more
Dillon's
Responded on June 18, 2021

Hi Debbie, We are advertised as a restaurant and bar. On a Saturday night our restaurant very much becomes a bar scene. I'm sorry that you didn't find the experience you were looking for. We hope you'll consider joining us at another time!

Overall3food5service5ambience1

i love dillons but it’s not advertised as a sports bar, so I don’t understand why they couldn’t play music AND keep the game on. Instead they had the TV blasting in our ears and when It went to commercials they didn’t even switch to music either it just had commercials blasting in our ear. Nobody wants to go to dinner to listen to commercials for two hours... they should at least have somebody switch to music once the commercial start because it’s not a consistent noise and it completely ruins the ambience... the commercials are also vastly different it goes from sad music to somebody yelling about buying a truck. Weird

+ Read more
Dillon's

Hey there! We are sorry you didn't enjoy your time with us this go-around. We play the TV sound when there are local Boston teams in playoffs (this time the Bruins). Thanks for the feedback on switching to and from sound during commercials, we'll definitely keep that in mind.

FAQs

You can order delivery directly from Dillon's using the Order Online button. Dillon's also offers takeout which you can order by calling the restaurant at (617) 421-1818.

Dillon's is rated 4.6 stars by 395 OpenTable diners.

Yes, you can generally book this restaurant by choosing the date, time and party size on OpenTable. Due to local restrictions, this restaurant may not be accepting reservations at the moment.
